alert.note: Alert for Chicot (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 15 at 10:20PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Chicot County through 1045 PM CDT... At 1020 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dermott, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Chicot County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. High winds can bring down trees and large limbs resulting in serious injury or property damage. Exercise extreme caution when outdoors during such strong winds...and be especially aware of older trees. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.
